question.text: According to the potassium pump theory, which activity will not occur for the opening of stomata?

options.text: Transport of  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>  ions from guard cells to subsidiary cells
Increased OP of guard cells by potassium malate.

solution.text: During the opening of stomata, malic acid dissociates into malate ion and <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> ions. An energy-dependent proton pump starts and transports <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> ions out of guard cells and <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">K</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> ions enter inside. The K<sup>+</sup> ions combine with malate ion to form potassium malate and thus increase the OP of guard cells. As a result, endosmosis occurs and stomata open.
